page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY 4
page.content: Burton's {millionaire}Richard Thornton born in a cottage beside village green, 2nd of 7 children of Robert Thornton, shoemaker, 1776. Charity scholar Christ's Hospital, London 1785 -1791. In business with uncle & at 22 member of Lloyds'. Made fortune during Napoleonic wars. Died 1865 leaving Â£3.8 million. Built and endowed Boys' and Girls' Schools in Burton, with houses for master & mistress. Also left Â£10 000 for poor of the village. His nephew, Thomas, who inherited a large share of his estate, carried out his wish that a church should be built on the site of his birthplace. All Saints' Church, designed by Paley, was dedicated in 1870.
